name: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Timeless wisdom from a Roman Emperor
description: A series of personal writings by Marcus Aurelius, Roman Emperor from 161 to 180 AD, recording his private notes to himself and ideas on Stoic philosophy.

name: The Republic
author: Plato
title: Socratic dialogue on justice and order
description: Plato's most famous work addressing the question of justice and examining the ideal state and the ideal individual.

name: Being and Time
author: Martin Heidegger
title: Phenomenological investigation of being
description: A groundbreaking work that explores the concept of Being through the lens of human existence and temporality.

name: The Ethics
author: Baruch Spinoza
title: Geometric approach to philosophy
description: Spinoza's magnum opus presents his views on God, nature, and human freedom in geometric form.

name: Beyond Good and Evil
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Critique of traditional morality
description: Nietzsche challenges the moral assumptions of his time and proposes new perspectives on truth and morality.

name: Critique of Pure Reason
author: Immanuel Kant
title: Foundation of critical philosophy
description: Kant's seminal work examining the limits and scope of human reason and knowledge.
